local_schema.short_desc: Give focus to guake if tab is opened (OBSOLETE).
local_schema.longdesc: If the guake window is out of focus but open, enabling this will give it back the focus instead of closing the window.

local_schema.short_desc: If the tabs bar must be visible in fullscreen
local_schema.longdesc: Set it as false to enjoy guake's fullscreen.

local_schema.short_desc: If guake must show a control to make resizing more handful
local_schema.longdesc: When true, guake shows a resizer on its bottom to allow user resize guake.

local_schema.short_desc: Characters that are considered "part of a word"
local_schema.longdesc: When selecting text by word, sequences of these characters are considered single words. Ranges can be given as "A-Z". Literal hyphen (not expressing a range) should be the first character given.
Defines the behavior of delete key.
Defines the behavior of backscape key.

local_schema.short_desc: Use terminal titles for tab naming
local_schema.longdesc: Any terminal program can set the terminal's title via special escape sequences. Some shells (e.g. bash) display user's prompt there (though you can adjust that to any arbitrary text in bashrc or similar) and update it automatically as the prompt changes. So you can have easy automatically updating meaningful tab titles with this option turned on.

local_schema.short_desc: Use palette font and backgrount colors
local_schema.longdesc: If true, the terminal font and background colors will use the value defined in the palette. If false, it will use the value defined by the user.
If true, Guake will use the GNOME monospace default font.
If true and a key is pressed, the terminal is scrolled to the bottom.
If true, whenever there is new output in the terminal, it will scroll to the bottom.
The number of scrollback lines to save in history.
When true, scrollbar is visible.
Place Guake at: 0: top, 1: bottom
Place Guake at: 0: center, 1: left, 2: right
Percent of the screen that will be used by guake terminal vertically.
Percent of the screen that will be used by guake terminal horizontally.
Percent of the screen that will be used by guake terminal horizontally.
If true, the terminal will flash on a bell character.
If true, the system alert sound will be played on a bell character.
When true, the program will start in fullscreen mode.

local_schema.short_desc: Startup script to execute when guake starts
local_schema.longdesc: This property allows you to execute a startup bash script each time guake starts. You can configure your initial tab settings within this script. Please see the command line argument of guake ('guake --help') for complete help.

local_schema.short_desc: Quick open the file in the current terminal.
local_schema.longdesc: If this property is set as true, guake will use the current terminal to execute the Quick open feature. Use if you want to inherit your terminal environment in your text editor

local_schema.short_desc: Command line pattern to start a editor.
local_schema.longdesc: This property gives the command line to execute when doing a Quick Open. You can enter the following python string pattern in it: '%(file_path)s' will be replaced with the full path to the captured filename, '%(line_number)s' will be replaced by the line number if found (set to the empty string otherwise).
If this property is set as true, guake will open a text editor when the user does a Ctrl+Click on a filename printed in the terminal.
When true, the tab bar is visible.

local_schema.short_desc: Determine if guake hides on lose focus.
local_schema.longdesc: If this property is set as true, guake will be hidden when the main window lose the focus (when Alt+Tab be pressed for example).
Makes tab bar on top of the Guake window. Per default, tabs appears bellow the terminal. Setting this to True will move the tab on top of the terminal. Requires a restart.
Makes guake window be on top of all other windows in the desktop.
0: Never 1: If process is running 2: Always. Also prompts on quit.
Ask for confirmation when quitting Guake.
When true, popup notifications will be shown when Guake starts.
When true tray is visible.
If true, the commands in terminal will be executed in a login shell.
Path to the default shell. Set to empty to use default user shell. If invalid path is set here, guake will fallback to user shell.

Display to appear on if the mouse_display option is not set. If this is set to an invalid value (as in the case of removing a screen from a system), the invalid value is automatically updated to the current primary screen.
Appear on the mouse display. This overrides any setting in display_n.
When debug mode is enabled, logs are printed in the standard output where Guake as been launched
